page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Our area lies on the western edge of the city of Sheffield, on an area previosly given over to rough pasture land and adjoining moorland. The area lies between 600 and 800 feet above sea level, therefore winter conditions of snow and ice make it a vulnerable site for communications. The major part of the housing estate is twenty years old and almost exclusively owner occupied. Approximately 10% of the area is made up of housing built between the wars and isolated farms trace their history back over 200 years. Two major features of the area are Lodge Moor Hospital, formally a fever hospital built well away from inhabited sites and now specialising in spinal injuries and the Hallamshire Golf Course which dominates the northern section of the block. {
